dish_description: The dish is a hamburger made with 4-ounce patties divided into 2-ounce portions, served on toasted English muffins with toppings such as lettuce, tomato, sweet onion, and condiments like ketchup or mayonnaise.

cooking_steps.description: Divide the 4-ounce hamburger patties into 2-ounce portions to fit better on English muffins.
Season the divided hamburger patties with a little bit of salt.
Apply a bit of oil to the patties before cooking.
Cook the patties on a grill or stovetop to the desired doneness, approximately 1.5 to 2 minutes on each side.
Toast the English muffins, potentially twice, to achieve a nice brown color.
Slice the tomato into four little slices and season with a bit of pepper.
Prepare the toppings by cutting lettuce and sweet onion, and by choosing condiments such as ketchup or mayonnaise.
Assemble the burger by placing lettuce, a slice of tomato, and sweet onion on the toasted English muffin, followed by the cooked hamburger patty, and then add ketchup or mayonnaise as preferred.
